last_episode_to_air.name: Through the Looking Glass, Part 2
last_episode_to_air.overview: The artists and their teams create their short film, and one is crowned champion, in part two of the finale.

name: Face Off
overview: In this competition/elimination series, special effects make-up artists participate in elaborate challenges for a grand prize and the honor of being Hollywood's next great effects artist.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: The first season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off featured twelve prosthetic makeup artists competing in a series of challenges to create makeup effects. The winner received US$100,000 and a year's supply of makeup. The season premiered on January 26, 2011. Conor McCullagh of Mississauga, Ontario was the winner of Face Off season one.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: The second season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on January 11, 2012 and ended on March 14, 2012. The season featured 14 prosthetic makeup artists competing in a series of challenges to create makeup effects. The winner of this season, Rayce Bird of Shelley, Idaho, received US$100,000 cash, US$25,000 worth of makeup from Alcone, and the 2012 Toyota Camry Hybrid.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview:
The third season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on August 21, 2012 and ended October 31, 2012. The season featured twelve prosthetic makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. In the finale, they were voted on by the public in a live broadcast on Halloween. Nicole Chilelli of Sacramento, California, was the winner of the season. The grand prize for the third season was a position as a guest lecturer at the Make Up for Ever Academies in New York and Paris, a 2012 Toyota Prius v, and US$100,000.

It was won by Nicole Chilelli, who holds two Face Off records for being the first female to win and the first and only contestant to be eliminated and come back.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: The fourth season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on January 15, 2013 and ended March 26, 2013. The season featured 14 prosthetic makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. Anthony Kosar of Lisle, Illinois, was the winner of the season. The grand prize for the fourth season was a position as a guest lecturer at the Make Up For Ever Academies in New York and Paris, a 2013 Fiat 500, and $100,000.

seasons.name: Season 5
seasons.overview: The fifth season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on August 13, 2013. The season features 16 prosthetic makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. This is the first season to feature the return of eight prior contestants competing against eight new contestants. The grand prize for the fifth season is a VIP trip from Kryolan to one of their 85 locations, a 2013 Fiat 500, and $100,000. A rule violation occurred and is noted during the end credits of episode 5, details are unknown.

seasons.name: Season 6
seasons.overview: The sixth season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on January 14, 2014. The season features 15 prosthetic-makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. In this season, the judges have the power to save one contestant who would normally be eliminated.

seasons.name: Season 7
seasons.overview: This season will have a specific theme, 'Life and Death'. In this season, the contestants faced a Sudden Death challenge, when, during the first episode, it was revealed that the contestants' first challenge is actually their final audition to be on the show.

seasons.name: Season 8
seasons.overview: The theme this season is "Return of the Champions". Three former winners Season 2 - Rayce Bird, Season 4 - Anthony Kosar, and Season 5 - Laura Tyler will guide teams of five to victory.

seasons.name: Season 11 - All Stars
seasons.overview: The eleventh season features the All-Stars, a group of artists who have competed in previous seasons of Face Off. Special guests this season include director John Landis, writer/director Paul W.S. Anderson, producer Suzanne Todd, director Marcus Nispel and stunt coordinator Jeff Wolfe.

seasons.name: Season 12
seasons.overview: In the twelfth season of Face Off the artists are split in two teams recognized as shops. Each week, the shops will choose a foreperson to take charge of the shop. The winning artist will receive a trip to Kryolan, a Fiat 500, and $100,000.

seasons.name: Season 13
seasons.overview: The thirteenth, and final season of  Face Off: Battle Royale, features the return of twelve former competitors, who will compete head-to-head against each other throughout the competition.

episodes.name: Welcome to the Jungle
episodes.overview: The challenge is to create a new human/animal hybrid based from 3 exotic animals that are brought into lab.

episodes.name: Naked Ambition
episodes.overview: A full-body makeup challenge for the contestants.

episodes.name: Out of this World
episodes.overview: Makeup artist Michael Westmore meets the contestants at Vasquez Rocks in Southern California, where episodes of "Star Trek" were shot, and the competitors learn that they must create an alien for a newly discovered world

episodes.name: Bad to the Bone
episodes.overview: "Friday the 13th" director Sean Cunningham serves as a guest judge for a challenge that has the contestants creating an original horror-movie villain along with an accompanying movie poster, title and tagline.

episodes.name: Switched and Hitched
episodes.overview: In teams of two, the contestants turn brides into grooms and grooms into brides.

episodes.name: Dancing Dead
episodes.overview: Zombies take over as the seven remaining special effects artists must create an original zombie to avoid the dreaded double elimination on “Dancing Dead”.

episodes.name: Family Plot
episodes.overview: The five remaining contestants must disguise themselves to fool their own family members at a Los Angeles wig shop.

episodes.name: Twisted Tales
episodes.overview: The last challenge has the three remaining contestants creating fairy-tale characters derived from "The Three Little Pigs," "Little Red Riding Hood" and "Hansel and Gretel" for a cocktail-party setting in the first-season finale.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview: The first season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off featured twelve prosthetic makeup artists competing in a series of challenges to create makeup effects. The winner received US$100,000 and a year's supply of makeup. The season premiered on January 26, 2011. Conor McCullagh of Mississauga, Ontario was the winner of Face Off season one.

episodes.name: Return to Oz
episodes.overview: Fourteen aspiring makeup artists face off in the Season 2 premiere, which has them re-imagining characters from "The Wonderful Wizard of Oz".

episodes.name: Water World
episodes.overview: The Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach is visited ahead of a challenge in which the contestants must make waterproof creature makeup.

episodes.name: Rock Your Body
episodes.overview: A nude body painting challenge unfolds as the contestants try to make an album cover for hip-hop star (and guest judge) Asher Roth.

episodes.name: Night Terrors
episodes.overview: A late-night call summons the contestants to an abandoned hospital in Los Angeles. When they arrive they each get to choose an obscure phobia to use as the basis for creating a monster.

episodes.name: Dangerous Beauty
episodes.overview: The team competes in a trauma wound foundation contest then return to the lab, which has been transformed into a jungle, and discover they'll be studying live animals to create something beautiful but deadly.

episodes.name: Triple Threat
episodes.overview: For the foundation challenge, the contestants must debeautify attractive models,.make triplets appear to be at different stages of their elderly lives.

episodes.name: Alien Interpreters
episodes.overview: This week, aliens are the artists' focus and guest judge Star Trek Next Generation's LeVar Burton helps out.

episodes.name: Burtonesque
episodes.overview: Creating a new character from an ordinary occupation for a Tim Burton film.

episodes.name: Dinoplasty
episodes.overview: The five remaining contestants participate in a double-elimination event to create a human-dinosaur hybrid to determine which of them will go to the finale.

episodes.name: The Ultimate Spotlight Challenge
episodes.overview: The finalists must each create three original characters from a specific movie genre who will perform a choreographed-dance routine at the Alex Theatre in Glendale, CA.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: The second season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on January 11, 2012 and ended on March 14, 2012. The season featured 14 prosthetic makeup artists competing in a series of challenges to create makeup effects. The winner of this season, Rayce Bird of Shelley, Idaho, received US$100,000 cash, US$25,000 worth of makeup from Alcone, and the 2012 Toyota Camry Hybrid.

episodes.name: A Force to Be Reckoned With
episodes.overview: Sean Astin greets the contestants, who are challenged to create original aliens for the “Star Wars” cantina scene in the Season 3 opener.

episodes.name: Pirate Treasure
episodes.overview: The contestants must create an original pirate character "who has become one with the sea".

episodes.name: Year Of The Dragon
episodes.overview: The Chinese New Year is the theme as the contestants create dragon makeup for performers doing an acrobatic dance routine.

episodes.name: Alice In Zombieland
episodes.overview: The contestants create zombie makeup for characters from "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland." Director Paul W.S. Anderson serves as a guest judge.

episodes.name: Supermobile
episodes.overview: The contestants create makeup for superheroes and their sidekicks after getting inspiration from some astonishing vehicles. Kevin Smith is a guest judge.

episodes.name: Dishonorable Proportions
episodes.overview: The artists take inspiration from the video game Dishonored when creating characters with exaggerated features for the challenge.

episodes.name: Monster Twist
episodes.overview: The competing artists are tasked with creating original movie monsters based on sketches done by children.

episodes.name: Who's the New Who?
episodes.overview: The competing artists use makeup to create looks inspired by Dr. Seuss' "Sleep Book," which is celebrating its 50th anniversary.

episodes.name: Junkyard Cyborg
episodes.overview: Material from a junkyard must be used in a cyborg challenge.

episodes.name: Scene of the Crime
episodes.overview: The NBC series "Grimm" inspires the makeup created by the competing artists.

episodes.name: Immortal Enemies
episodes.overview: The remaining three artists are tasked with creating Halloween-themed characters, which they then must have perform in a choreographed stunt show.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: Viewers choose the Season 3 winner, who will be announced during the finale in Los Angeles. Also: The eliminated artists reunite.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview:
The third season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on August 21, 2012 and ended October 31, 2012. The season featured twelve prosthetic makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. In the finale, they were voted on by the public in a live broadcast on Halloween. Nicole Chilelli of Sacramento, California, was the winner of the season. The grand prize for the third season was a position as a guest lecturer at the Make Up for Ever Academies in New York and Paris, a 2012 Toyota Prius v, and US$100,000.

It was won by Nicole Chilelli, who holds two Face Off records for being the first female to win and the first and only contestant to be eliminated and come back.

episodes.name: Make It Reign
episodes.overview: The artists create goblin kings and are judged by actor John Rhys-Davies.

episodes.name: Heroic Proportions
episodes.overview: The artists compete for the chance to have their design featured in a DC Comic book; the contestants must create an original superhero.

episodes.name: When Hell Freezes Over
episodes.overview: Contestants must create a sinister demon.

episodes.name: Eye Candy
episodes.overview: The contestants must create a creature using candy that is found throughout the lab.

episodes.name: Two Heads Are Better Than One
episodes.overview: The artists try to create a larger-than-life giant character based on an ancient fable.

episodes.name: Bugging Out
episodes.overview: The contestants will choose images to be used for a creepy-crawly bug-themed challenge.

episodes.name: Howl at the Moon
episodes.overview: The contestants must create planet-inspired alien werewolves.

episodes.name: It's Better in the Dark
episodes.overview: The artists must create a never-before-seen creature that glows in the dark.

episodes.name: Mummy Mayhem
episodes.overview: The artists must create an Egyptian god mummy inspired by the Evil Dead franchise.

episodes.name: Alien Apocalypse
episodes.overview: The artists visit the set of the new Syfy series "Defiance" to inspire original alien creations.

episodes.name: Living the Dream
episodes.overview: The three finalists must create a waterproof makeup for the show "Le Reve: The Dream" at the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas.

4.name: Season 4
4.overview: The fourth season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on January 15, 2013 and ended March 26, 2013. The season featured 14 prosthetic makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. Anthony Kosar of Lisle, Illinois, was the winner of the season. The grand prize for the fourth season was a position as a guest lecturer at the Make Up For Ever Academies in New York and Paris, a 2013 Fiat 500, and $100,000.

episodes.name: Going for Gold
episodes.overview: Eight newcomers take on eight former contestants as each team creates a series of hyper-stylized fantasy characters.

episodes.name: Future Frankenstein
episodes.overview: The contestants must make a far-future monster.

episodes.name: Gettin' Goosed
episodes.overview: After a demon-based foundation challenge with guest judges James Wan and Lin Shaye, the remaining contestants take on classic Mother Goose characters for a double-elimination with instructions to put a modern spin on them.

episodes.name: Subterranean Terror
episodes.overview: Artists explore tunnels in search of clues.

episodes.name: Mother Earth Goddess
episodes.overview: Artists use elements from an arboretum and their own mothers to create Mother Nature goddesses.

episodes.name: Trick or Treat
episodes.overview: The artists are asked to incorporate a gag element to their designs.

episodes.name: Living Art
episodes.overview: The artists must create characters that could live within iconic art movements.

episodes.name: Cosmic Circus
episodes.overview: Artists are faced with creating dark and sexy alien circus characters for an out-of-this-world performance.

episodes.name: Mortal Sins
episodes.overview: The artists learn they must each create a character that embodies one of the seven deadly sins.

episodes.name: The Laughing Dead
episodes.overview: Arriving at the famous Laugh Factory comedy club, the artists are tasked with creating an original ghost character that is funny and scary.

episodes.name: Dark Magic
episodes.overview: At Kenneth Hahn Park, the artists are asked to choose magical Norse runes to inspire a dark elf warrior character.

episodes.name: Flights of Fantasy
episodes.overview: The contestants create original human-bird hybrids for the penultimate Spotlight Challenge.

episodes.name: Swan Song
episodes.overview: The artists must create a sorcerer and swan for a special performance.

episodes.name: Naked And Painted
episodes.overview: The art of body painting is demonstrated and explored during an hour hosted by McKenzie Westmore and featuring commentary by the cast of "Naked Vegas" and former "Face Off" contestants.

episodes.name: Top 20 Countdown - Judges' Favorites
episodes.overview: Judges Ve Neill, Glenn Hetrick and Neville Page recall the best creations from five seasons of "Face Off" as they count down the Top 20 make ups from the show, as well as reveal their picks for the funniest, most surprising and ambitious designs.

5.name: Season 5
5.overview: The fifth season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on August 13, 2013. The season features 16 prosthetic makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. This is the first season to feature the return of eight prior contestants competing against eight new contestants. The grand prize for the fifth season is a VIP trip from Kryolan to one of their 85 locations, a 2013 Fiat 500, and $100,000. A rule violation occurred and is noted during the end credits of episode 5, details are unknown.

episodes.name: Sexy Beasts
episodes.overview: An extreme new season of Face Off starts with a bang as 15 new artists work in teams of two to reinvent one of the most classic fairy tale characters of all time - Beast from Beauty and the Beast.

episodes.name: Cosmic Conspiracy
episodes.overview: The 14 remaining artists create out-of-this-world alien creatures suffering from an array of interplanetary ailments.

episodes.name: Dragon's Breath
episodes.overview: For their first individual Spotlight Challenge, the 13 remaining artists face the monumental task of creating original dragon makeups.

episodes.name: Guitar Gods
episodes.overview: The artists get ready to roll 'n rock as they team together to build an original rock star character who has truly become one with an electric guitar.

episodes.name: In the Shadows
episodes.overview: The remaining artists take a walk on the dark side as they're tasked with creating supernatural entities based on mysterious silhouettes.

episodes.name: Cryptic Creatures
episodes.overview: The artists arrive at a beautiful yet mysterious swamp and learn that they'll be making some famously fabled creatures unknown to science - Cryptids.

episodes.name: Open Sesame
episodes.overview: The artists arrive at the mysterious Magic Castle in Hollywood where they learn they'll create unique wizards characters.

episodes.name: Ego Trip Abroad
episodes.overview: The artists embark on a trip of a lifetime to Tokyo where they'll gather inspiration for two extreme challenges inspired by the ancient culture of Japan.

episodes.name: Mad Science
episodes.overview: Things take a dark turn as the artists play the part of mad scientist and create human guinea pig makeups inspired by bizarre medical devices.

episodes.name: What a Dahl
episodes.overview: The artists delve into the whimsical world of children's author Roald Dahl and must create never before seen characters. Screenwriter, author, and Roald Dahl's daughter Lucy Dahl guest judges.

episodes.name: Freaks of Nature
episodes.overview: The six remaining artists head to the prestigious Gnomon School of Visual Effects and learn that they will be working with visual effects artists to create original mutants.

episodes.name: Industrial Revolution
episodes.overview: The artists head to Union Station and discover that they'll be heading into the future to create original robots tailored to a specific profession.

episodes.name: Bloodsuckers
episodes.overview: Pressure mounts as the four remaining artists create legendary vampires from around the world in order to earn a spot in the finale.

episodes.name: Cry Wolf
episodes.overview: In the dramatic conclusion to Face Off's first ever two-part challenge, the four remaining artists compete for their spot in the finale by creating werewolf rivals for the legendary vampires they created in the prior episode.

episodes.name: Heavenly Bodies
episodes.overview: After a season-long battle, the final three artists must create two rival aliens that can survive a rigorous dance performance.

6.name: Season 6
6.overview: The sixth season of the Syfy reality television series Face Off premiered on January 14, 2014. The season features 15 prosthetic-makeup artists competing against each other to create makeup effects. In this season, the judges have the power to save one contestant who would normally be eliminated.

episodes.name: Life and Death
episodes.overview: Sixteen new contestants learn they aren't officially on the show until they survive one final audition.

episodes.name: American Gangster
episodes.overview: The artists must create over-the-top makeup for crime bosses in the world of Dick Tracy.

episodes.name: Ancient Aliens
episodes.overview: The artists explore the world's wonders and ancient aliens who may have contributed to their creation.

episodes.name: Twisted Trees
episodes.overview: A superhero foundation challenge; the artists must create twisted tree characters after becoming one with nature.

episodes.name: Animal Attraction
episodes.overview: The artists have to successfully mash-up two animals to create a new species in an individual challenge.

episodes.name: Wizard of Wonderland
episodes.overview: Teams must re-imagine characters from "The Wonderful World of Oz," as if they were in "Alice's Wonderland."

episodes.name: Judge Match
episodes.overview: The judges pair up with two team members, a former all-star contestant and former champion, to create a pair of living chess pieces in a special competition for charity.

episodes.name: Killer Instinct
episodes.overview: In partnership with Universal Studios' Halloween Horror Nights, the artists' mission is to create a horror villain inspired by original movie posters and their tag lines.

episodes.name: Serpent Soldiers
episodes.overview: Working for the G.I. Joe franchise, the artists use their talents to create snake-inspired super soldiers.

episodes.name: Scared Silly
episodes.overview: The artists turn their worst childhood fears into terrifying evil clowns who will perform a nightmarish circus routine.

episodes.name: Teacher's Pets
episodes.overview: It's back to high school for the remaining artists as they are tasked with creating fun mythical fantasy characters based on classic high school stereotypes.

episodes.name: Off With Their Heads
episodes.overview: The artists are faced with the challenge of creating a Greek God and also the severed head of a beast they have slain.

episodes.name: Beautiful Disaster
episodes.overview: With the semifinals around the corner, the artists must take inspiration from disaster scenarios and craft elemental fairies born from each one.

episodes.name: Creature Carnage
episodes.overview: The four semifinalists conquer giant city-crushing monstrosities in order to crush their way straight into the finale.

episodes.name: One Knight Only
episodes.overview: The season of life and death concludes as the artists tackle the fantastical world of knights in an effort to win the crown.

7.name: Season 7
7.overview: This season will have a specific theme, 'Life and Death'. In this season, the contestants faced a Sudden Death challenge, when, during the first episode, it was revealed that the contestants' first challenge is actually their final audition to be on the show.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Season 8 begins with three returning champions joining the competition as coaches.

episodes.name: Monkey Business
episodes.overview: Oscar winner Rick Baker is the guest judge for the first Spotlight Challenge, which finds the artists working in teams to create two original alien characters, plus a primate leader.

episodes.name: Let the Games Begin
episodes.overview: The remaining 14 artists take part in a deadly predator challenge featuring guest judge Josh Hutcherson ("The Hunger Games").

episodes.name: Royal Flush
episodes.overview: The thirteen remaining artists must make playing cards come to life in the whimsical style of Tim Burton for their first individual Spotlight Challenge of the competition

episodes.name: Sounding Off
episodes.overview: The artists have to design creatures based on unique sound effects created by sound designer Erik Aadahl.

episodes.name: Troll Bridge
episodes.overview: The remaining artists and their coaches feel the stress of a challenge where they must create trolls inspired by iconic bridges.

episodes.name: Queen Bees
episodes.overview: The artists learn that for their challenge, they will be body-painting nude models in the middle of the woods.

episodes.name: Dressed To Kill
episodes.overview: The artists create their own stylish horror villain inspired by the work of Clive Barker (Hellraiser, Nightbreed).

episodes.name: Miss Intergalactic
episodes.overview: The contestants must take inspiration from the planets in the solar system to create alien queens who compete in a intergalactic beauty pageant.

episodes.name: Imaginary Friends
episodes.overview: The Artists must make their Imaginary Friends from their childhood as a film character or creature.

episodes.name: Deadly Dolls
episodes.overview: The artists must create serial killer doll characters

episodes.name: Full Steam Ahead
episodes.overview: The artists must create western steampunk cyborgs, in order to make it into the finals at the Vinpearl Land Amphitheater in Nha Trang, Vietnam.

episodes.name: The Dream Team
episodes.overview: The final three artists must each create four original characters worthy of starring in their own film franchise, at the Vinpearl Land Amphitheater in Nha Trang, Vietnam.

8.name: Season 8
8.overview: The theme this season is "Return of the Champions". Three former winners Season 2 - Rayce Bird, Season 4 - Anthony Kosar, and Season 5 - Laura Tyler will guide teams of five to victory.

episodes.name: Intergalactic Zoo
episodes.overview: Season 9 begins with the 16 artists working in pairs to construct original alien animals that incorporate two models into one massive creation. Later, a surprise announcement from the judges keeps everyone on edge.

episodes.name: Siren Song
episodes.overview: The artists arrive at the Port of Long Beach and board the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter U.S.S. George Cobb, which is where they learn they'll be making beautiful but deadly sirens based on unique sea creatures. Working in teams of two, one group feels compelled to start from scratch on Day 2. At the same time, another duo struggles with streamlining different visions into one makeup.

episodes.name: Surprise of the Century
episodes.overview: The reality competition celebrates its 100th episode in style when the artists turn real-life couples into whimsically undead duos. Following the challenge, host McKenzie Westmore, who recently became an ordained minster, will perform a marriage ceremony attended by friends and family.

episodes.name: Frightful Fiction
episodes.overview: The artists must create a mashup character from famous works of genre literature.

episodes.name: The Gatekeepers
episodes.overview: The artists paired up to create the gatekeeper to an alternate dimension ... and the creature he or she guards.

episodes.name: Extraterrestrial Enterprise
episodes.overview: Retro-style alien characters created for a Foundation Challenge come into play when the artists receive their Spotlight Challenge.

episodes.name: All That Glitters
episodes.overview: The artists face the challenge of taking a male model and turning him into a female character from a classic Shakespearean play.

episodes.name: Judgment Day
episodes.overview: The remaining artists add their own twist to the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse.

episodes.name: Freak Show
episodes.overview: A "barbaric" Foundation Challenge is judged by Oscar-winning makeup artist Robin Matthews. That's followed by a trip to the circus as the seven remaining artists compete to dazzle the judges with their freak show-inspired makeups.

episodes.name: Beyond The Expanse
episodes.overview: Inspired by Syfy's The Expanse, the artists must create a character that represents the next stage in human evolution.

episodes.name: Movie Magic, Part 1
episodes.overview: Part 1 of 2. The finalists learn their last challenge is to work with a real-life Hollywood director and full production crew to create three stunning short films on location.

episodes.name: Movie Magic, Part 2
episodes.overview: A winner is crowned in the conclusion of the two-part Season 9 finale. But first, the finalists finish work on their characters for the short films they're making with director and creature designer Patrick Tatopoulos.

episodes.name: Wanted Dead or Alive
episodes.overview: Season 10 begins with the 14 competing artists working in teams of two to create alien bounty hunters.

episodes.name: Child's Play
episodes.overview: Paul Reubens appears when the artists work in teams to create a whimsical makeup based on an oversized toy.

episodes.name: Lost Languages
episodes.overview: The remaining 12 artists team up to create a member of a long-lost race inspired by unique languages created by "Game of Thrones" linguist David Peterson.

episodes.name: Covert Characters
episodes.overview: For their first individual challenge, the artists must create realistic disguise makeups for "secret agents".

episodes.name: Foreign Bodies
episodes.overview: Working in teams of two, the artists must create slime as inspiration for the spotlight challenge. The winning team receives immunity.

episodes.name: Death's Doorstep
episodes.overview: The artists must create whimsical ghost characters based on unique obituaries.

episodes.name: The Gauntlet II
episodes.overview: It's back. Three rounds of foundation challenges. Who will survive?

episodes.name: Smoke and Mirrors
episodes.overview: The artists must transform beautiful, yet evil sorceresses into their hideous true self.

episodes.name: Bottled Up
episodes.overview: Unique vessels provide the inspiration when the artists face the challenge of creating mischievous genie characters.

episodes.name: Keep One Eye Open
episodes.overview: The artists create unique Cyclops characters in the Focus Challenge; guest judge Douglas Smith.

episodes.name: The Art of Warcraft
episodes.overview: Characters from the World of Warcraft game come to life by the remaining artists who create realistic characters for the 2016 film adaptation, which stars guest judge Robert Kazinsky.

episodes.name: Skull Island: Reign of Kong
episodes.overview: Artists create an indigenous species that would live on King Kong's Skull Island.

episodes.name: Sinister Showdown: Part 1
episodes.overview: The artists must create two characters that would be part of a horror film: one demonic character and one possessed character. Three different directors with different scripts of the film named "Hell Hole" will work with each artist. Eliminated contestants will also aid the finalists during the challenge. On the first part of the challenge, the artists create their characters to later get feedback from their directors on what to improve on during a lighting test.

episodes.name: Sinister Showdown: Part 2
episodes.overview: After revising their makeups with their directors, the artists improve their characters in order to get them ready for filming.

episodes.name: Abstract Aliens
episodes.overview: A group of returning all-stars compete in Season 11, which begins with the artists having to incorporate green screen technology when creating unique alien creatures.

episodes.name: The Devil Is in the Details
episodes.overview: The teams work to create angel and devil characters in the first elimination challenge of the season.

episodes.name: Monster High
episodes.overview: The artists arrive at Mattel headquarters in El Segundo, Cal., where they learn they will be creating film-ready versions of "Monster High" characters in this immunity challenge.

episodes.name: Snow Queens
episodes.overview: In the second elimination challenge of the season, the All-Star teams work to create beautiful snow queens inspired by a series of unique snowflakes.

episodes.name: Troubling Transformations
episodes.overview: The competition takes a monstrous turn as the All-Star teams create two makeups themed after Jekyll and Hyde in the elimination challenge for guest judge John Landis.

episodes.name: Wasteland Warriors
episodes.overview: The All-Stars create dystopian characters inspired by post-apocalyptic vehicles for the elimination challenge.

episodes.name: Puppet Masters
episodes.overview: The conclusion from last week's elimination challenge; the immunity challenge has the teams create magical marionette characters.

episodes.name: Odd Couples
episodes.overview: The five remaining All-Star teams create comedic fantasy duos in the elimination challenge.

episodes.name: Frightening Families
episodes.overview: The competition is turned on its head as the eight remaining all-stars are combined into a pair of super teams that must each create a frightening family of three mutated characters.

episodes.name: Cursed Covens
episodes.overview: The two teams must create a coven of warlocks or witches at war with each other.

episodes.name: Intergalactic Congress
episodes.overview: The remaining artists, competing individually, must create an alien delegate for an intergalactic congress

episodes.name: Tiki Twist
episodes.overview: The final five must create a representation of a Hawaiian god or goddess.

episodes.name: Gargoyle Guardians
episodes.overview: The last four must create a gargoyle inspired by a different style of architecture

episodes.name: Battle of the Beasts
episodes.overview: The final three must create animalistic kung-fu masters for an actual fight scene in hopes of being declared the winner in the Season 11 finale...

11.name: Season 11 - All Stars
11.overview: The eleventh season features the All-Stars, a group of artists who have competed in previous seasons of Face Off. Special guests this season include director John Landis, writer/director Paul W.S. Anderson, producer Suzanne Todd, director Marcus Nispel and stunt coordinator Jeff Wolfe.

episodes.name: Pack Leaders
episodes.overview: In a first, the artists are divided into two make-up effects shops, and the first assignment is to design a werewolf pack.

episodes.name: Hive Mind
episodes.overview: Inspired by hive-minded insects, the artists must create queen, worker and drone aliens.

episodes.name: Dream House
episodes.overview: A twist with the teams, and an assignment to create fairy tale characters. Elizabeth Mitchell guest judges.

episodes.name: Dante's Demons
episodes.overview: The artists must create a demon that would oversee a specific circle of Dante's version of Hell.

episodes.name: String Theory
episodes.overview: The artists bring the four seasons to life for a dance choreographed by Travis Wall.

episodes.name: Possessed Possessions
episodes.overview: The artists create looks for the owners of possessed objects; Cheyenne Jackson guest judges.

episodes.name: Feral Fungi
episodes.overview: The six remaining artists create victims of a fungal virus that turns people into zombies.

episodes.name: Amusing Aliens
episodes.overview: The legendary Rick Baker guest judges the artists' alien creations, inspired by real recordings from space.

episodes.name: Journey Into Fear Part 1
episodes.overview: The final three must create creatures for a haunted house conceptualized by series judge Glenn Hetrick.

episodes.name: Journey Into Fear, Part 2
episodes.overview: Twists abound for the final three's haunted house challenge before crowning a winner.

12.name: Season 12
12.overview: In the twelfth season of Face Off the artists are split in two teams recognized as shops. Each week, the shops will choose a foreperson to take charge of the shop. The winning artist will receive a trip to Kryolan, a Fiat 500, and $100,000.

episodes.name: Face Your Fears
episodes.overview: In the season premiere of Face Off, twelve of your favorite artists return to the competition with a twist: this time they’re battling.

episodes.name: Moonlight Monsters
episodes.overview: In the first elimination challenge of the season, the artists battle it out as they create fun and lighthearted monsters inspired by real life day jobs.

episodes.name: Aztec Aliens
episodes.overview: The artists create ancient aliens that could have been the inspiration for Aztec gods.

episodes.name: Haunted Hotel
episodes.overview: In this week's elimination challenge, the artists battle head-to-head as they create the quirky and ghostly staff of a haunted hotel.

episodes.name: Death Dealers
episodes.overview: Fortune favors the bold this week, as the artists and their battle partners create makeups based on actual tarot card readings.

episodes.name: Divine Dryads
episodes.overview: The artists battle it out as they create dryad protectors of real life forests in this week’s elimination challenge, with two more artists heading home.

episodes.name: Maritime Monsters
episodes.overview: The competition intensifies as the six remaining artists create original sea monsters in this week's battles, with the help of an industry expert in next week's elimination challenge on the line.

episodes.name: Immortals Interrupted
episodes.overview: It's the semifinals and the artists engage in an all out battle royale as they create vampires based on real life bats with just three finale spots on the line.

episodes.name: Through the Looking Glass Part I
episodes.overview: It's part one of the finale, as the finalists learn that they will be creating characters for an original short film based on the book, "Through the Looking-Glass and What Alice Found There."

episodes.name: Through the Looking Glass, Part 2
episodes.overview: The artists and their teams create their short film, and one is crowned champion, in part two of the finale.

13.name: Season 13
13.overview: The thirteenth, and final season of  Face Off: Battle Royale, features the return of twelve former competitors, who will compete head-to-head against each other throughout the competition.
